dt-option.name: fixedHeader
dt-option.default: FixedHeader is not automatically enabled on a DataTable. This parameter should be used if you wish to use this feature.

type.description: Enable FixedHeader, using the defaulting configuration options (defined by `$.fn.dataTable.FixedHeader.defaults`).
Fine grained initialisation control of FixedHeader allowing full configuration of the available options. Please refer to the individual initialisation options for full details.

dt-option.description:
FixedHeader is an extension for DataTables that provides the ability to show a header and / or footer that is _sticky_ - i.e. the element will affix itself to the top or bottom of the window as the end user scrolls through the table. The result is that the end user will be able to see the header / footer of the table as they scroll through the table. The fixed elements will then scroll off the page as the user scrolls past the table.
This configuration option provides configuration options for FixedHeader, including simple initialisation and finer grained control of the individual features of FixedHeader.

example.title: Enable FixedHeader with footer also enabled
